solution.text:
Distance between Pune and Mumbai = 149 km.
Amount of petrol taken to complete that journey =_{{k+Decimal('0.2')}}_ litres
Thus, amount of petrol used for 1 km of travel = \(\frac {_{{k+Decimal('0.2')}}_}{149} litres\) [Unitary Method]
Distance between Mumbai and Surat=289.7km
Thus, the amount of petrol required for the journey = \(\frac {_{{k+Decimal('0.2')}}_}{149} \times 289.7 = _{{trunc( ((k+Decimal('0.2'))/149)*Decimal('289.7'), 2 )}}_ litres\)

content.text: The distance between Pune and Mumbai is 149km. Your car covered the distance using _{{k+Decimal('0.2')}}_ litres of petrol. The distance between Mumbai and Surat is 289.7km. How much petrol does your car require to complete the drive from Mumbai to Surat?
